1.content:
"Do you have the money?" The man asks, his eyes dart around nervously.

You nod silently and hand over the wad of cash.

He quickly counts it then shoves a brown paper bag into your hands and disappears into the shadows without another word.

You make your way quickly back to your apartment, always looking over your shoulder , worried that someone might be following you.

Finally you get in and lock the door. Then you go to your secret hiding spot and carefully pull out the old Sony Diskman. It was very difficult to get and just as illegal as your growing collection of CDs.

You take your newest disc out of the bag, click it into place and shut the lid. You hear the disc begin to spin in the player as you put on the headphones. Then the music starts. The vocalist sings about sex, violence, drugs and rebellion, all the while using words that would get you arrested if you ever said them. Tanya was right. This was a great album.

Your friend, Tanya had introduced you to pre-Matriarchy music a little over a year ago. You were hooked instantly and ever since you managed to track down your own CD player you've been building a collection of your own.

Your enjoyment is interrupted by the doorbell. Then a loud voice calls your name. "Melanie Orwell. This is the Department of Supervision. We believe you are in possession of illegal media. Surrender yourself peacefully."

You try to remain calm and figure out what to do. You're only on the first floor so you may be able to jump from your balcony.
1.title: Contraband

choices: Insist that you don't have anything illegal
Admit that you have the music
11.content:
You dismiss the idea of running. They'd catch you eventually and you'd only look more guilty.

Shoving the player and CDs back into their hiding spot, you compose yourself and answer the door. In the corridor outside your apartment stand 3 supervision officers, 1 woman and 2 men.

"Melanie Orwell?" The woman asks. She is obviously the highest ranking officer. The Department of Supervision is one of the few places a man can obtain any authority. However, they always report to a woman.

"Yes." you say, trying not to let your fear give you away.

"I'm officer Rachel Huxley." She introduces herself. "These are officers Stephen Bradbury and Daniel Heinlein. We have reason to believe that you are in possession of illegal media."

"There must be some mistake." you say. "I don't have anything like that."

"Don't lie." Officer Huxley tells you sternly. "We only want to help you be a better citizen. Don't you want to make the matriarchs happy?"
11.title: Surrender

112.content:
"Yes. I'm sorry officer." you say. "I have illegal music and a CD player."

Office Huxley pulls you into a warm hug. "There." she says. "Doesn't it feel better to tell the truth?"

You nod. "What is going to happen to me?" you ask.

"You've been a naughty girl." she says. "Your behavior must be corrected so that you don't do this again."

After you show the officers your hiding place, they drive you to a large building. No signs indicate the building's purpose.

You are led inside by Officer Huxley. There is a small waiting area with a reception desk.

"How may I help you?" the man at the desk asks.

"I've brought a candidate for reeducation." The officer explains.

"I'll let the headmistress know." the man says. "Please put her int the induction room."

"Reeducation?" you ask, concerned.

"Don't worry honey." she says leading you to a door. "I'll make sure they know you've been very cooperative. They shouldn't be too hard on you if you follow the rules." She opens the door and urges you inside. You step in and she closes and locks the door behind you.

The room is decorated in soft colours. There is a comfortable-looking chair and some children's toys. Opposite the door you entered through is another one. You try to open it but its locked.

You sit on the chair and wait but nothing happens
112.title: Admit that you have the music

choices: Refuse to let her diaper you
1122.content:
You look through the toys. Some are similar to ones you remember from childhood. Selecting a doll, you change its outfit and begin to act out a story with other dolls. You feel a little silly but it helps pass the time.

"Good." a woman says as she enters through the second door. "I think you're going to fit in here very nicely."

You drop the dolls, embarrassed to be caught being so childish.

"Don't be embarrassed." she says. "You're encouraged to play with dolls here."

"What?" you ask confused. "What is this place."

"Come." she says offering her hand. "I'll explain on the way to your room."

"As you know, the relationship between the matriarchs and citizens is like that between a mother and her child." She starts. "Some citizens forget that or simply don't understand what that means. This program demonstrates that relationship by making it literal."

"What do you mean by literal?" you ask.

"Here you will be treated like a young child. The staff here will be your mommies. I am Mommy Susan." she explains. "You must learn to accept it and behave accordingly before you can graduate from the program."

"How young exactly?" you ask.

"Officer Huxley said you were very cooperative so you will start off about 4 years old." Mommy Susan says, opening a a door. "Here's your room."

"Start off?" you ask, looking around the room which looks exactly like a young girl's bedroom.

"If you don't cooperate you will be demoted to a younger age." she says.

"What does that mean?" you ask.

"At 4 you'll need to wear diapers to bed." She says. "At.."

"Diapers?" you cut her off.

"At 3 you also wear training pants when you aren't in bed." she continues ignoring your interruption. "At 2 it's diapers full-time."

"And 1?" you ask.

"Only the most difficult children are demoted to 1." she says. "That's when we use medication to keep you completely incontinent and reduce your coordination to the point that you are unable walk very well or take care of yourself."

You just stare at her in disbelief.

"But I know you'll behave yourself." she says. "And then you'll be promoted to 5, where you only need to wear training pants in bed and after that you graduate."

"That means I can go home?" you ask.

"Yes." she nods and smiles. "Now I think we should get you into bed." She unlocks a drawer in the wall and pulls out a large disposable diaper. "Get undressed and lay on the bed."

One grasps your left arm, the other your right, and they half-drag you out of the room. After a series of corridors, they lead you into another room. This one has a giant cot and changing table. As promised, it's a nursery.

You feel something sharp being stuck in your arm. Then the men release their grip on you and leave, shutting the door behind them.

You let yourself fall to the grass below. The landing hurts but you are still able to run.

The only person you know who might be willing or able to help you is Tanya. You make your way to her apartment and ring the bell. There's no answer. In a panic you knock. And again louder.

You hear a door open and turn to see a man stepping out from the next apartment. "She's not there." He says. "Supervision officers took her away yesterday. I think they found illegal media."

"Shit" you say too loudly.

The man gasps and goes back into his apartment. You'd better get out of here. He looks like the sort who'd report bad language.

info.description:
If you like reading or writing interactive stories with AB/DL themes please join our Google Group:
https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/thicklypadded

You live under a benevolent but authoritarian matriarchy. The government enforces strict censorship to protect its citizens from unpleasant or antisocial ideas. The majority of citizens accept this and appreciate the loving care the matriarchy takes in selecting suitable news, education and entertainment for them.

You, however, are not one of the obedient majority. Fortunately for you, the matriarchy's justice is as loving as its censorship. They don't want to punish you. They want to help you learn to let the matriarchy take care of you.

Disobedient citizens, like you, are sent to a special facility for reeducation. There they are treated like very young children (in some serious cases even infants) and raised again to be well-behaved members of society.
